attributes.action: restrict the hours that taxi drivers can work in a single shift. following the death of my son who was knocked down & killed by a driver who had worked in excess of 14hours
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is our understanding that at present their is no legal limit to the hours that taxi drivers can work. It seems both dangerous & unbelievably remiss in these days of health & safety standards that someone who drives for a living is not governed by the same rules & regulations that apply to H.G.V. &P.S.V. drivers. How can someone who has been driving for anything up to 24 hours in a single shift not be a danger to other road users, pedestrians & passengers alike?

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "restrict the hours that taxi drivers can work in a single shift. following the death of my son who was knocked down & killed by a driver who had worked in excess of 14hours."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22557
